examination: Check that the baby is pink
notes: Do not bathe for first 24 hours
Do not slap, pinch or turn baby upside down
Continue newborn care if breathing resumes

subsections.title: NEWBORN WITHOUT ANY COMPLAINT – THE WELL CHILD

history: Ask about feeding pattern and sleeping
Any family history of birth defects
examination: Check for cleft lip/palate, limb deformities
action: Refer for surgical or specialist intervention

examination: Inspect oral cavity for thrush, cleft palate, or infection
action: Treat thrush with nystatin if present
Encourage continued breastfeeding or proper diet
history: Ask about recent illnesses or hospital visits

examination: Check for rash, sore throat, ear discharge
action: Treat presumptive malaria if endemic area
Refer if fever persists > 3 days or danger signs present

history: Ask about birth and immunization history

examination: Assess for rash, throat inflammation, ear signs
action: Refer if fever >3 days or with convulsions
Treat with antibiotics if pneumonia suspected
Refer if wheezing or chronic symptoms

history: Associated fever, vision issues, or stress
entries.clinical_judgement: Likely tension headache or febrile illness

action: Provide education on puberty and hygiene
Refer if abnormal bleeding or delayed puberty
Refer if signs of delayed or abnormal development
Educate on safe sex and STI prevention

entries.case: Concerns about sexual performance or function
action: Refer to adolescent or psychological services if persistent
Refer for lab testing if unclear
Refer for forensic and psychological care
Refer if signs of infection or neurological signs

entries.clinical_judgement: Likely upper respiratory infection or otitis media

examination: Check BMI and conduct general exam
Signs of infection (e.g. throat, chest, abdomen)
action: Refer if fever persists >3 days or severe symptoms
Refer for sputum test or X-ray

entries.clinical_judgement: Possible asthma, COPD or heart failure

action: Refer if blood in stool or severe dehydration
Refer if persistent or associated with fever
Refer for persistent or severe cases

entries.clinical_judgement: Likely iron deficiency or chronic disease

examination: Signs of malnutrition or systemic illness

action: Cool burn, dress, refer if extensive

examination: Abdominal examination for fetal growth and lie
Test urine for protein and sugar
action: Administer routine ANC medications (iron, folic acid, IPTp)
Schedule next visit or refer if high-risk
Educate on use and side effects

entries.case: Woman or couple with infertility concerns
examination: Check for signs of hormonal imbalance
action: Refer for fertility evaluation and counseling
Refer if abnormal bleeding or other complications

entries.clinical_judgement: Possible heart failure or ischemic disease
action: Refer for ECG and further assessment
Treat UTI or refer male with suspected BPH

entries.clinical_judgement: Likely age-related digestive issue or pathology
action: Refer if persistent or alarming signs
Refer for psychiatric or neurologic evaluation

entries.clinical_judgement: Dental caries, gingivitis or fungal infection

action: Implement principles of planning, organizing, leading, and controlling
Develop clear organograms and job descriptions

entries.clinical_judgement: Effective leadership is essential for service delivery
action: Lead by example and build trust among healthcare workers

entries.clinical_judgement: HRH is key to effective PHC
action: Conduct staff appraisals and manage conflict
Maintain proper financial records and reports

entries.clinical_judgement: Efficient data management improves service delivery
action: Train staff on data collection tools (e.g., NHMIS)
Use data for planning and decision-making
